content.question: All of the following claims made by Saint-Maurice in Source 2 directly advocate for the abolition of slavery in Saint-Domingue EXCEPT

choices.label: that “White hands will never suffice to work the land under a burning sun”
that “everything tells you that man will no longer be the slave of man”
that “He is your equal, because he is a man”
that “neither the nation nor the Supreme Being created slaves”

content.answer: that “White hands will never suffice to work the land under a burning sun”

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and describe a claim or argument in a text-based or non-text-based source.
